sen.j: 鴨東線（おうとうせん）は、京都府京都市東山区の三条駅 (京都府)から同市左京区の出町柳駅までを結ぶ京阪電気鉄道の鉄道路線。
sen.e: The Oto Line (鴨東線: pronounced as Oto-sen) is a railway of Keihan Electric Railway and connects Sanjo Station in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture with Demachiyanagi Station in Sakyo Ward in the same city.
sen.cmt: 「鴨東線（おうとうせん）」とありますが、"outou-sen"とせず"oto-sen"と英文音表記にあわせました。京阪電気鉄道→Keihan Electric Railway [http://www.keihan.co.jp]
sen.e: The Oto Line (鴨東線: pronounced Oto-sen) is a railway of Keihan Electric Railway that connects Sanjo Station in the Higashiyama ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture with Demachiyanagi Station in the Sakyo ward of the same city.

The Oto Line (鴨東線: pronounced Oto-sen) is a railway of Keihan Electric Railway that connects Sanjo Station in the Higashiyama Ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture with Demachiyanagi Station in the Sakyo ward of the same city.

sen.j: 路線名は鴨川 (淀川水系)の東岸を走行することから。
sen.e: The railway name derives from that fact that the line is running along the east bank (東岸: togan） of Kamo-gawa River (鴨川: "鴨" is also pronounced "o (u)"), belonging to the Yodo-gawa system.
sen.cmt: (東岸: togan） および (鴨川: "鴨" is also pronounced "o(u)") と音読説明を加えました。
sen.e: The railway name derives from that fact that the line is running along the east bank (東岸: togan） of Kamo-gawa River (鴨川: "鴨" is also pronounced "o (u)"), belonging to the Yodo-gawa system.
The railway name derives from the fact that the line runs along the east bank (東岸: togan） of the Kamo-gawa River (鴨川: 鴨 is also pronounced as o (ou)), belonging to the Yodo-gawa River system.
sen.cmt: " "削除 Yodo-gawa River systemとしました。

sen.j: 京阪本線の延長線として鴨川沿いの川端通の地下に建設され、全線が地下線となっている。
sen.e: It was laid under the ground along of the road by the river, as an extension line of the Kyoto Main Line, and the whole line runs underground.
It was laid below ground along the road by the river, as an extension of the Kyoto Main Line, and the entire line runs underground.
It was laid below ground along Kawabata-dori Street by the Kamo-gawa River, as an extension of the Keihan Main Line, and the entire line runs underground.
sen.cmt: Kawabata-dori Street, Keihan Main Lineとしました

sen.j: また、開業当初から建設費（約650億円）償還のために普通運賃で60円の加算運賃が同線区間利用時に設定されており、鴨東線内各駅（三条駅から出町柳駅方面も含む）からの初乗り運賃は、2007年現在210円と京阪本線の初乗り運賃より高くなっている。
sen.e: Since this line has been repaying the construction cost (about 650 million yen) since its inauguration, for the line, an extra fare of 60 yen is added to the ordinary fare structure by section, and the basic fare between the stations on the line (including the section starting from Sanjo Station toward the direction of Demachiyanagi Station) is 210 yen, more expensive than that of the Kyoto Main Line as of 2007.

Because this line has been repaying the construction cost (about 650 million yen) since its inauguration, for the line an extra fare of 60 yen is added to the ordinary fare structure by section, and the basic fare between the stations on the line (including the section starting from Sanjo Station toward the direction of Demachiyanagi Station) is 210 yen, which is more expensive than that of the Kyoto Main Line (as of 2007).

Because this line has been repaying the construction cost (about 65 billion yen) since its inauguration, for the line an extra fare of 60 yen is added to the ordinary fare structure by section, and the basic fare between the stations on the line (including the section starting from Sanjo Station toward the direction of Demachiyanagi Station) is 210 yen, which is more expensive than that of the Keihan Main Line (as of 2007).
sen.cmt: 65 billion, Keihan Main Line に修正しました。

sen.j: 路線距離（営業キロ）：2.3km
sen.e: Railway distance (operation kilometers): 2.3km
Railway distance (operation kilometers): 2.3km
Railway distance (operation kilometers): 2.3 km
sen.cmt: 2.3 km とスペース追加しました。

sen.j: 軌間：1435mm
sen.e: Track gauge: 1435mm
sen.cmt: 軌間→track gauge [英辞郎 on the WEB]
sen.e: Track gauge: 1435mm
Track gauge: 1435 mm
sen.cmt: 1435 mm とスペース追加しました。

sen.j: 駅数：3駅（起終点駅含む）
sen.e: Number of stations: 3 stations (including the starting station and the final station)
Number of stations: three (including the starting station and the final station)
Number of stations: three (including the stations at both ends of the track section)
sen.cmt: 表現をより自然なものに修正

sen.j: 複線区間：全線
sen.e: Double-tracked section: whole the line
Double-tracked section: the entire line
Double-tracked section: the entire line

sen.j: 電化区間：全線電化（直流1500V）
sen.e: Electrified section: the whole line (DC1500V)
Electrified section: the entire line (DC1500V)
Electrified section: the entire line (DC1500V)

sen.j: 閉塞 (鉄道)：自動閉塞式
sen.e: Block (railway) system: automatic block system
sen.cmt: 自動閉塞式→automatic block system[英辞郎 on the WEB] [http://www.wdic/d/RAIL/FAC/BLK]
sen.e: Block (railway) system: automatic block system
Block (railway) system: automatic block system

sen.j: 京阪本線と一体的に運行されており、全て大阪淀屋橋駅方面へ直通する。
sen.e: It is operated in an integrated manner with the Keihan Main Line, and all trains go directly toward Osaka Yodoyabashi Station (Osaka).
sen.cmt: 「大阪淀屋橋駅方面」とありますが、「大阪淀屋橋」という駅名は無いようですので、Yosoyabashi Station (Osaka)としました。
sen.e: It is operated in an integrated manner with the Keihan Main Line, and all trains go directly toward Osaka Yodoyabashi Station.
It is operated in an integrated manner with the Keihan Main Line, and all trains go directly toward Yodoyabashi Station (Osaka).

sen.j: 朝の三条発出町柳行き2本を除き鴨東線内だけで運行される列車はない。
sen.e: There is no train shuttling inside the Oto Line except for two trains starting from Sanjo Station for Demachiyanagi Station in the morning.
There is no train shuttling within the Oto Line except for two trains that start from Sanjo Station bound for Demachiyanagi Station in the morning.
There is no train shuttling within the Oto Line except for two trains that start from Sanjo Station bound for Demachiyanagi Station in the morning.

sen.j: 特急が平日昼間・休日終日、2006年4月16日の改正から普通が終日、K特急・急行と数本の準急が昼間以外の時間帯（K特急は平日のみ）に運転されている。
sen.e: Limited Express train service is provided during the daytime on weekdays and all day on holidays, and since the timetable revision made on April 16, 2006, Local trains are operated all day, and K-Ltd. Express and Express trains and several Sub-express trains are operated all hours except for during daytime (K-Ltd. Express is operated only weekdays).
sen.cmt: 特急→Limited Express [http://japanize.jp/transportation_tips.htmlを参照しましたが、Ltd. Expressとはせず、Limited Expressとしました]、K特急→K-Ltd. Express[http://japanize.jp/transportation_tips.html]、急行→Express[http://japanize.jp/transportation_tips.html]、準急→Sub-express [http://japanize.jp/transportation_tips.html]
sen.e: Limited express train service is provided during the daytime on weekdays and all day on holidays; moreover, because the timetable revision made on April 16, 2006, local trains are operated all day, and the K-Ltd. Express, express trains and several sub-express trains are operated all hours except for during daytime (the K-Ltd. Express is operated only on weekdays).

Limited express train service is provided during the daytime on weekdays and all day on holidays; moreover, with the timetable revision of April 16, 2006, local trains are operated all day, and the K-Ltd. Express, express trains and several sub-express trains are operated all hours except for the daytime (the K-Ltd. Express is operated only on weekdays).
sen.cmt: because を withに変更しました。

sen.j: 唯一の途中駅である丸太町駅には急行以下の種別の列車が停車する。
sen.e: At Marutamachi Station, the only station that exists in between, Express or lower category trains make a stop.
sen.cmt: 急行以下の種別の列車→定訳不明[Express or lower category trainsとしました]
sen.e: At Marutamachi Station, the only station that exists in between, express or lower-category trains make stops.
At Marutamachi Station, the only station that exists in between, express or lower-category trains make stops.

sen.j: 各列車種別毎の停車駅は京阪本線を参照のこと。
sen.e: For stops by type of train, please refer to the Keihan Main Line.
For stops by type of train, please refer to the Keihan Main Line.
For stops by type of train, please refer to the Keihan Main Line.

sen.j: 当線の免許は1924年（大正13年）に京福電気鉄道の前身である京都電燈が取得していた。
sen.e: The operation license of the line had been acquired in 1925 by Kyoto Dento, the predecessor of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
sen.cmt: 京都電燈→Kyoto Dento (http://oldphotosjapan.com/en/photos/160/kiyamachi、htto://www.kcif.or.jp/en/newsletter/lik/archives/0506_2005.html)、京福電気鉄道→Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd. (http://www.keifuku.co.jp)
sen.e: The operating license of the line was acquired in 1925 by Kyoto Dento, the predecessor of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
The operating license of the line was acquired in 1924 by Kyoto Dento, the predecessor of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 京都電燈は1925年に叡山平坦線（現在の叡山電鉄叡山本線）を開業させたが、鴨東線については京都市電と平面交差することになることや景観の問題から地上に作ることができず、また、京福電鉄の経済的な事情から地下鉄として建設することもできず、なかなか着工されなかった。
sen.e: Kyoto Dento opened the Eizan-heitan Line (current Eizan Electric Main Line of Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.) in 1925, but it took a lot of time to start the construction, because it was impossible to lay the Oto Line on the ground, owing to the fact that the line would inevitably intersect with the Kyoto City Tram at grade and might also spoil the sight, and moreover, because of the financial conditions of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., the company was not capable to construct a subway line.
sen.cmt: 叡山電鉄→ Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.[http://www.keihannet.ne.jp/eiden/company/profile/profile.html]
sen.e: Kyoto Dento opened the Eizan-heitan Line (currently the Eizan Electric Main Line of Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.) in 1925; however, it took a lot of time to start the construction because it was impossible to lay the Oto Line on the ground, owing to the fact that the line would inevitably intersect with the Kyoto City Tram at grade and might also spoil the sight, and because of the financial conditions of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., the company was not capable of constructing a subway line.

Kyoto Dento opened the Eizan-heitan Line (currently the Eizan Main Line of Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.) in 1925; however, it took a lot of time to start the construction because it was impossible to lay the Oto Line on the ground, owing to the fact that the line would inevitably intersect with the Kyoto City Trams at grade and might also detract from the surroundings, and because of the financial conditions of Keifuku Electric Railroad the company wasn't capable of constructing a subway line.
sen.cmt: Eizan Main Line of the Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.としました。 既出のため Keifuku Electric Railroad のCo., Ltd.は削除しました。

sen.j: このため長らく「幻の路線」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Therefore, it had been called "Phantom Line" for a long time.
sen.cmt: 「幻の路線」→定訳不明 ["Phantom Line"としました]
sen.e: Therefore, it had been called "Phantom Line" for a long time.
Therefore, it had been called the 'Phantom Line' for a long time.

sen.j: 京阪本線の京都地下線の建設が具体化するのにあわせ、1972年に京阪電鉄が中心となって鴨川電気鉄道が設立され、日本鉄道建設公団方式でようやく着工された（近鉄東大阪線（現・近鉄けいはんな線の生駒駅以西）と全く同じ手法である）。
sen.e: When the project of the Keihan Main Line to underground the section running in the Kyoto area started to give shape, finally Keihan Electric Railway and other entities established a company, Kamogawa Electric Railway, in 1972, and started the construction by the Japan National Railway Construction Public Corporation (JRCC) method (exactly the same method as the Kintetsu Higashi-Osaka Line (the current Kintetsu Keihanna Line, the section from Ikoma Station and to the west)).
sen.cmt: 鴨川電気鉄道→定訳不明：Kamogawa Electric Railway [用語リスト#17612参照]、日本鉄道建設公団→ Japan National Railway Construction Public Corporation (JRCC) [英辞郎 on the WEB]
sen.e: When the project of the Keihan Main Line to under-ground the section running in the Kyoto area started to take shape, finally Keihan Electric Railway and other entities established a company, Kamogawa Electric Railway (in 1972) and started the construction by the Japan National Railway Construction Public Corporation (JRCC) method (exactly the same method as the Kintetsu Higashi-Osaka Line (the current Kintetsu Keihanna Line, the section from Ikoma Station and to the west)).

When the project of the Keihan Main Line to under-ground the section running in the Kyoto area started to take shape, finally Keihan Electric Railway and other entities established a company, Kamogawa Electric Railway (in 1972) and started the construction by the Japan National Railway Construction Public Corporation (JRCC) method (exactly the same method as the Kintetsu Higashi-Osaka Line (the current Kintetsu Keihanna Line, the section from Ikoma Station and to the west)).

sen.j: 1989年に京阪電鉄が鴨川電鉄を合併し、同年京阪鴨東線として開業した。
sen.e: In 1989, Keihan Electric Railway swallowed Kamogawa Electric Railway, and in the same year, the railway was inaugurated as the Keihan Oto Line.
sen.cmt: 鴨川電気鉄道→定訳不明：Kamogawa Electric Railway
sen.e: In 1989, Keihan Electric Railway swallowed Kamogawa Electric Railway, and in the same year the railway was inaugurated as the Keihan Oto Line.
In 1989, Keihan Electric Railway swallowed Kamogawa Electric Railway, and in the same year the railway was inaugurated as the Keihan Oto Line.

sen.j: 当初は出町柳駅から叡山電鉄叡山本線（1986年、京福電鉄から叡山電鉄に分離譲渡）と直通運転する構想であったが、車両規格や輸送力の差が大きすぎるがために実現しなかった。
sen.e: At first, it was planned to provide a direct operation from Demachiyanagi Station to the Eizan Main Line of Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd. (in 1986, it was separated and transferred from Keifuku Electric Railroad to Eizan Electric Railway), however the plan did not take shape, because there is a great difference in gauge and transportation capacity between the two lines,

Initially, it was planned to provide direct operation from Demachiyanagi Station to the Eizan Main Line of Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd. (in 1986 it was separated and transferred from Keifuku Electric Railroad to Eizan Electric Railway); however, the plan did not take shape because there is a great difference in gauge and transportation capacity between the two lines,

Initially, it was planned to provide direct operation from Demachiyanagi Station to the Eizan Main Line of the Eizan Electric Railway (in 1986 it was separated and transferred from Keifuku Electric Railroad to Eizan Electric Railway); however, the plan didn't take shape due to the different gauges and transportation capacities of the two lines,
sen.cmt: 既出のため、Eizan Main Line of Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd. の Co., Ltd. は削除しました。

sen.j: 鴨東線開業の効果は大きく、沿線の通勤客のみならず、出町柳駅近くに立地する京都大学や同志社大学などへの通学が大幅に便利になって定期客が増加したり、乗客の減少で経営が悪化していた叡山電鉄が一気に乗客を取り戻すなど大きく貢献している。
sen.e: The inauguration of the Oto Line caused remarkable effects, contributing to the increase of not only the commuters along the line but also the regular passengers, thanks to the improved accessibility for students to Kyoto University and Doshisha University located near Demachiyanagi Station, and it also beneficiated Eizan Electric Railway, which had been suffering a severe financial health due to the decline of passengers, to recovered the users at once.
sen.cmt: 京都大学→Kyoto University [http://www.kyoto-u.ac.jp/ja]、同志社大学→Doshisha University [http://www.doshisha.ac.jp/japanese/]
sen.e: The inauguration of the Oto Line caused remarkable effects, contributing to the increase not only of commuters along the line but also regular passengers, thanks to the improved accessibility for students to Kyoto University and Doshisha University located near Demachiyanagi Station; additionally, it beneficiated Eizan Electric Railway, which had been suffering severe financial condition due to the decline of passengers, but it promptly recovered its user statistics.

The inauguration of the Oto Line caused remarkable effects, contributing to the increase not only of commuters along the line but also regular passengers, thanks to the improved accessibility for students to Kyoto University and Doshisha University located near Demachiyanagi Station; additionally, it beneficiated Eizan Electric Railway, which had been suffering severe financial condition due to the decline of passengers, but it promptly recovered its user statistics.

sen.j: その後も比較的順調に推移しており、建設費の償還は予定通り進んでいるようである。
sen.e: Since then, its business performance has been relatively satisfactory and the construction cost also seems to have been steadily reimbursed as scheduled.
Since then, its business performance has been relatively satisfactory and the construction cost also seems to have been steadily reimbursed as scheduled.
Since then, its business performance has been relatively satisfactory and the construction cost also seems to have been steadily reimbursed as scheduled.

sen.j: 1924年（大正13年）8月29日 京都電燈（京福電気鉄道の前身）が出町柳～三条間の地方鉄道敷設免許取得。
sen.e: August 29, 1924: Kyoto Dento (the predecessor of Keifuku electric Railroad) acquired the license for local railway construction between Demachiyanagi Station and Sanjo Station.
sen.cmt: 地方鉄道敷設免許→定訳不明 [ｌicense for local railway constructionとしました]
sen.e: August 29, 1924: Kyoto Dento (the predecessor of Keifuku Electric Railroad) acquired a license for local railway construction between Demachiyanagi Station and Sanjo Station.
August 29, 1924: Kyoto Dento (the predecessor of Keifuku Electric Railroad) acquired a license for local railway construction between Demachiyanagi Station and Sanjo Station.

sen.j: 1972年（昭和47年）7月1日 鴨川電気鉄道設立。
sen.e: July 1, 1972: Kamogawa Electric Railway was established.
sen.cmt: 鴨川電気鉄道→定訳不明 [Kamogawa Electric Railway としました]
sen.e: July 1, 1972: Kamogawa Electric Railway was established.
July 1, 1972: Kamogawa Electric Railway was established.

sen.j: 1974年（昭和49年）2月20日 京福電気鉄道の出町柳～三条間の地方鉄道敷設免許失効。
sen.e: February 20, 1974: The validity of Keifuku Electric Railway's license for local railway construction between Demachiyanagi Station and Sanjo Station was expired.
sen.cmt: 地方鉄道敷設免許→定訳不明 [ｌicense for local railway constructionとしました]
sen.e: February 20, 1974: The Keifuku Electric Railway's license for local railway construction between Demachiyanagi Station and Sanjo Station expired.
February 20, 1974: The Keifuku Electric Railroad's license for local railway construction between Demachiyanagi Station and Sanjo Station expired.
sen.cmt: Keifuku Electric Railroad としました。

sen.j: 1974年（昭和49年）2月25日 鴨川電気鉄道が出町柳～三条間の地方鉄道敷設免許取得。
sen.e: February 25, 1974: Kamogawa Electric Railway acquired the license for local railway construction between Demachiyanagi Station and Sanjo Station.
sen.cmt: 鴨川電気鉄道→定訳不明 [Kamogawa Electric Railway としました]、地方鉄道敷設免許→定訳不明 [ｌicense for local railway constructionとしました]
sen.e: February 25, 1974: Kamogawa Electric Railway acquired a license for local railway construction between Demachiyanagi Station and Sanjo Station.
February 25, 1974: Kamogawa Electric Railway acquired a license for local railway construction between Demachiyanagi Station and Sanjo Station.

sen.j: 1984年（昭和59年）11月30日 鴨東線建設工事起工式。
sen.e: November 30, 1984: The groundbreaking ceremony for the construction of the Oto Line was held.
November 30, 1984: The groundbreaking ceremony for the construction of the Oto Line was held.
November 30, 1984: The groundbreaking ceremony for the construction of the Oto Line was held.

sen.j: 1989年（平成元年）4月1日 京阪電気鉄道が鴨川電気鉄道を合併。
sen.e: April 1, 1989: Keihan Electric Railway took over Kamogawa Electric Railway.
April 1, 1989: Keihan Electric Railway took over Kamogawa Electric Railway.
April 1, 1989: Keihan Electric Railway took over Kamogawa Electric Railway.

sen.j: 1989年（平成元年）10月5日 鴨東線として開業。
sen.e: October 5, 1989: The railway opened as the Oto Line.
October 5, 1989: The railway opened as the Oto Line.
October 5, 1989: The railway opened as the Oto Line.

sen.j: 2008年（平成20年）10月19日 京阪中之島線開業に併せて京都市営地下鉄烏丸線に同名の駅がある丸太町駅を神宮丸太町駅に改称予定。
sen.e: October 19, 2008: With the inauguration of the Keihan Nakanojima Line, Marutamachi Station is scheduled to change its name to Jingu-marutamachi Station, because on the Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line, there is a station which has the same name.
sen.cmt: 京都市営地下鉄烏丸線→Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line(http://www.city.kyoto.jp/kyoto.eng/access/subway.html)、神宮丸太町駅→Jingu-marutamachi Station (http://www.okeinhan.net/eki/detail.php?station_no=41)
sen.e: October 19, 2008: With the inauguration of the Keihan Nakanojima Line, Marutamachi Station was scheduled to change its name to Jingu-marutamachi Station, because on the Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line there is a station that has the same name.

October 19, 2008: With the inauguration of the Keihan Nakanoshima Line, Marutamachi Station was scheduled to change its name to Jingu-marutamachi Station, because on the Kyoto Municipal Subway Karasuma Line there is a station with the same name.
sen.cmt: Keihan Nakanoshima Line としました。

sen.j: 三条駅 (京都府) - 丸太町駅 (京阪) - 出町柳駅
sen.e: Sanjo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Marutamachi Station - Demachiyanagi Station
Sanjo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Marutamachi Station - Demachiyanagi Station
Sanjo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Marutamachi Station - Demachiyanagi Station

sen.j: 三条駅：京阪本線・京都市営地下鉄東西線（三条京阪駅）
sen.e: At Sanjo Station: Keihan Main Line, Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line (Sanjo Keihan Station)
sen.cmt: 京都市営地下鉄東西線→Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line (http://www.city.kyoto.jp/kyoto.eng/access/subway.html)、三条京阪駅→Sanjo Keihan Station(http://www.city.kyoto.jp/kyoto.eng/access/subway.html)
sen.e: At Sanjo Station: Keihan Main Line, Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line (Sanjo Keihan Station)
At Sanjo Station: Keihan Main Line, Kyoto Municipal Subway Tozai Line (Sanjo Keihan Station)

sen.j: 出町柳駅：叡山電鉄叡山本線
sen.e: At Demachiyanagi Station: Eizan Railway Eizan Main Line
At Demachiyanagi Station: Eizan Railway Eizan Main Line
At Demachiyanagi Station: Eizan Main Line of the Eizan Electric Railway
sen.cmt: Eizan Main Line of the Eizan Electric Railway としました。
